property.description: Property sheet to hold xml specification for forms

procedure.description: Creates a new container under the specified account. If the container with the same name already exists, the operation fails.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
A name for the container. Value can only include lower-case characters.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure.
The primary access key for the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Creates a new container under the specified account. If the container with the same name already exists, the operation fails.

procedure.description: Uploads a new service package and creates a new deployment on staging or production.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Specifies the base-64 encoded service configuration file for the deployment.
Specifies the name for the deployment. The deployment name must be unique among other deployments for the hosted service.
Specifies the environment in which to deploy the virtual machine
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
Represents the name of an extended deployment property. The Name element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
A name for the hosted service.
A URL that refers to the location of the service package in the Blob service.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
Specifies the unique DNS Prefix value in the Windows Azure Management Portal.
Indicates whether to start the deployment immediately after it is created. The StartDeployment element is only available using version 2010-04-01 or higher.
Indicates whether to treat package validation warnings as errors.
Represents the value of an extended hosted service property. The Name element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher. Required if 'Name' is set.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Uploads a new service package and creates a new deployment on staging or production.

procedure.description: Creates a new hosted service in Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: The name of an existing affinity group associated with this subscription. Required if Location is not specified.
The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
A description for the hosted service.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
A name for the hosted service that is base-64 encoded. The name can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.
The location where the hosted service will be created. Required if 'Affinity Group' is not specified.
Represents the name of an extended hosted service property. The Name element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
Specifies the hosted service.
Represents the value of an extended hosted service property. The Name element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher. Required if Name is set.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Creates a new hosted service in Windows Azure.

procedure.description: Creates a new storage account in Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: The name of an existing affinity group in the specified subscription. Required if Location is not specified.
The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
A description for the storage account.
Specifies whether the storage account is created with the geo-replication enabled. The GeoReplicationEnabled element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
A name for the storage account specified as a base64-encoded string. The name can be used identify the storage account for your tracking purposes.
The location where the storage account is created. Required if 'Affinity Group' is not specified.
Represents the name of an extended storage account property. The Name element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
A name for the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure. This name is the DNS prefix name and can be used to access blobs, queues, and tables in the storage account.
Represents the value of an extended storage account property. The Value element is only available using version 2012-03-01 or higher. Required if Name is set.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Creates a new storage account in Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: Name for the Azure configuration.
Azure Active Directory Tenant ID.
Credentials for any virtual machines provisioned using this configuration.
Azure Active Directory Subscription ID
Windows Azure subscription ID and certificate thumbprint
Provide the debug level for the output: 0=errors only, 1=normal headers and responses, 2+=debugging information included.
Provide the subscription id.
Provide the tenant id.
A description for this configuration.

step.description: Create an Azure configuration.

procedure.description: Marks the specified blob or snapshot for deletion. The blob is later deleted during garbage collection.

formalParameter.description: The name of the blob. Value can only include lower-case characters.
The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
The name of the container. Value can only include lower-case characters.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure.
The primary access key for the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Marks the specified blob or snapshot for deletion. The blob is later deleted during garbage collection.

procedure.description: Marks the specified container for deletion. The container and any blobs contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
The name of the container. Value can only include lower-case characters.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure.
The primary access key for the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Marks the specified container for deletion. The container and any blobs contained within it are later deleted during garbage collection.

procedure.description: Deletes the specified hosted service from Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure. This name is the unique DNS Prefix value in the Windows Azure Management Portal

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Deletes the specified hosted service from Windows Azure.

procedure.description: Deletes the specified storage account from Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure. This name is the DNS prefix name and can be used to access blobs, queues, and tables in the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Deletes the specified storage account from Windows Azure.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration to delete.

step.description: Delete an Azure configuration.

procedure.description: Returns the primary and secondary access keys for the specified storage account.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
A name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure. This name is the DNS prefix name and can be used to access blobs, queues, and tables in the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Returns the primary and secondary access keys for the specified storage account.

procedure.description: Returns the status of an operation in Windows Azure

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
ID for the request you wish to track.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Returns the status of the operation.

procedure.description: Creates a new block blob or page blob, or updates the content of an existing block blob.

formalParameter.description: The content of the blob.
Upload a file to the current storage account.
Path to the file to upload.
Specifies the maximum size for the page blob, up to 1 TB. The page blob size must be aligned to a 512-byte boundary.
A name for the blob. Value can only include lower-case characters.
The sequence number is a user-controlled value that you can use to track requests.
Specifies the type of blob to create: block blob or page blob.
The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
The name of the container. Value can only include lower-case characters.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
The ElectricCommander location to store properties (default is /myJob/Azure/deployed).
The unique tag for this operation to keep it separate from others stored in the same results location.
The name of the storage account that is unique within Windows Azure.
The primary access key for the storage account.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Creates a new block blob or page blob, or updates the content of an existing block blob.

procedure.description: Creates a new VM under the specified account.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
The name of the resource group in which VM is to be created.
Location of the resource.
Provided URN is a user image or not.
Type of operating system.
The image URN in the form publisherName:offer:skus:version/ The source VHD link of a user image, e.g. https://foo.blob.core.windows.net/system/Microsoft.Compute/Images/vhds/snap-bar.vhd.
Number of instances to create.
Create Public IP address for the server.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Creates a new VM under the specified account.

procedure.description: Deletes a VM under the specified account.

formalParameter.description: The name of the configuration which holds all the connection information for Windows Azure.
Location of the resource.
Timeout for the step execution in minutes. Blank means no timeout.
A name for the Vitual Machine.

step.description: Set the timelimit for the next step.
Deletes VM the specified account.
